transcript_segments.text: After 12 minutes, the chicken is about 80% cooked. The rest will cook on dum. Add some chopped mint and coriander on top.
Now, for biryani rice, take 2 cups of short-grain “Chitti Muthyalu” rice. I'm using the Sudhanya brand short rice for this recipe.
Once rice is 80% cooked, in a separate pan, melt ¼ cup ghee. Add ¼ cup cashews and fry until golden. When they change color, add 10–15 raisins and fry lightly.
In the remaining ghee, add 2 medium sliced onions and fry till golden brown. While onions are frying, add 2-inch cinnamon sticks, 10 cloves, 10 cardamoms, and salt to taste.
In about 6–7 minutes, everything will turn golden brown. The rice must be cooked to that light golden color. Once done, for every 2 cups of rice, double the water is used.
As you can see, after about 12–14 minutes, my rice is about 80% cooked.
Now for dum cooking, take a large handi, add 50% of the prepared chicken gravy along with the chicken pieces and spread evenly. Then layer 50% of the cooked ghee rice on top.
Now add the remaining rice on top of the chicken. Over the rice, sprinkle chopped mint, coriander, all the fried dry fruits, and 2 pinches of garam masala.

instruction: Repeat layering with remaining chicken, rice, and garnishes. Ensure the final layer is rice topped with fried onions and herbs.
title: Repeat Layers
